Authors:
Gislaine Ang√©lica Rodrigues Silva, Alexandre Antonelli,
Anita Lendel, Maura Helena Manfrin, Evandro Marsola Moraes
Title:
The impact of early Quaternary climate change on the
diversification and population dynamics of a South American cactus
species
Keywords:
Cactaceae, Climate change, Molecular dating,
Phylogeography, Pliocene, Population structure, Quaternary.
Abstract:
Aim Climatic oscillations have been suggested to promote
speciation and changes in species distributions, mostly in connection
with the Last Glacial Maximum (LGM). However, the LGM is just the most
recent of the 20+ glacial-interglacial periods that characterize the
Quaternary. Here we investigate the role of climatic changes on the
evolution and population dynamics of the South American cactus Cereus
hildmannianus, and geomorphological features in shaping the population
distribution.
